notes: We count the reported number as "persons tested". Total tests are taken from the annotations on the charts on the page. Negatives are inferred from (totals – positives). Negatives reported on site have decreased at various times, without explanation. Latest update time taken from [this page](http://dhss.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/id/Pages/COVID-19/default.aspx).
name: Alaska

notes:
Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives seem to occasionally update before totals do; when this happens, rather than revising negatives down, we keep the last calculated negative.
If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00.
name: Alabama

notes: The state reports "specimens" tested, but it appears that here, 1 specimen = 1 person. Hospitalized number from [news report](https://www.eldoradonews.com/news/2020/mar/23/more-businesses-asked-close-9-more-covid-19-cases-/) as is the [number of people on ventilators](https://www.wmcactionnews5.com/2020/03/25/gov-asa-hutchinson-arkansas-department-health-give-update-covid-/).
name: Arkansas

notes: American Samoa: No data, no confirmed cases yet.
name: American Samoa

notes: Negative = “Ruled Out”. Negatives are from public labs only. Arizona has 2 numbers for AHPL positives which often conflict by a small amount. We now use the number in the "Laboratory Type" table after confirming that this number correctly de-duplicates people who were tested in both public and commercial labs. As of 3/23, Positive includes [Navajo Nation counts](https://www.opvp.navajo-nsn.gov/News-Media/Press-Releases).
name: Arizona

notes: Since CA is now issuing press releases every day on a consistent schedule, we will only be updating numbers based on official CA-reported numbers. We add the death count back into the positive results number, because California has been excluding them from their positive count. We assume that "tests conducted" = "people tested."
name: California

notes: Negative is from state lab only. Total private tests unknown. Cases include people who test positive for COVID-19 AND people who have symptoms of COVID-19 and are a close contact to someone who tested positive.
name: Colorado

notes: Latest negative count is inferred from a [press conference](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vxY3Tv-RHeQ&feature=emb_logo) mentioning "over 700 tests" performed. At the time there were 96 positives. On 3/19, [an order](https://portal.ct.gov/Office-of-the-Governor/News/Press-Releases/2020/03-2020/Governor-Lamont-Coronavirus-Update-March-19-2020-6PM) went out requiring labs to report total tested/negative test numbers, so we expect more comprehensive numbers soon. Deaths from [news report](http://connecticut.news12.com/story/41922030/lamont-4th-covid19-death-confirmed-in-ct-total-cases-at-194).
name: Connecticut

notes: Positive and Negative include both public and commercial labs.
name: District Of Columbia

notes: Last reported negative number is from 3/13.
name: Delaware

notes: Drop in positives after 3/26 due to methology change: only Florida residents are now included per CDC recommendation. Jump in negatives on 3/21 due to change in methodology. Used to only report negatives who were PUIs by state, excluding people tested at commercial/hospital labs and whom the counties never investigated as PUIs.
name: Florida

notes: Positive includes deaths. The page includes a "report generated" time at the bottom of the page and a data "as of" time. We use the "as of" time a the top of the page as our Update Time.
name: Georgia

notes: Guam: Data conveyed in individual press releases
name: Guam

notes: Now reporting negatives in daily [press releases](https://health.hawaii.gov/news/covid-19-updates/), tucked at the bottom. The state [retracted](https://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/2020/03/24/state-officials-report-first-coronavirus-related-death-hawaii/) its first COVID-related death.
name: Hawaii

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Not all commercial labs report negatives to Iowa, as per their guidance.
name: Iowa

notes: Total includes Oregon residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).  Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives seem to occasionally update before totals do; when this happens, rather than revising negatives down, we keep the last calculated negative.
name: Idaho

notes: Our data differs from Illinois because we count deaths as positives.
name: Illinois

notes: Negative = Total – Positive. Totals are incomplete for private labs, so negatives are a lower bound.
name: Indiana

notes: Latest numbers from [daily KS update](https://khap2.kdhe.state.ks.us/NewsRelease/COVID19/COVID-19_March_24_2020_.pdf).
name: Kansas

notes: Deaths from [news reports](https://www.kentucky.com/news/coronavirus/article241440851.html). Negatives decreased for unknown reasons on 3/20.
name: Kentucky

notes: Negative = Total - Positive. Hospitalizations reported [separately](http://ldh.la.gov/index.cfm/newsroom/detail/5509).
name: Louisiana

notes: Positives include results from the CDC. Total tested includes repeat testing on individuals. State lab numbers are as of 8 am, other lab numbers are as of 11:30 am. Commercial lab numbers are subject to change.
name: Massachusetts

notes: Maryland does not report negative test results anymore. We are using the last negative provided as of 3/12.
name: Maryland

notes: Use the time at the top row of the table. Recovered added to Positive to count accurately towards total.
name: Maine

notes: Michigan stopped reporting negatives on 3/20. We've rolled that number forward. On 3/26, they began reporting "total specimens" tested as 11886, but we are waiting from guidance from the state before adding the number to their total because specimens tested is not equal to people tested.
name: Michigan

notes: Minnesota stopped providing negative test result numbers on 3/23/20, so negatives are as of 3/22/20. Hospitalization number is from Minnesota Department of Health press conference.
name: Minnesota

notes: Missouri displays an aggregate positive case number and a county-level breakdown: we use the higher number on the premise it is more up to date. Negatives and Totals are only from public health sources. Negatives from [news reports](https://www.kyoutv.com/home/2020/03/16/coronavirus-cases-numbers/).
name: Missouri

notes: Mariana Islands: No data, no confirmed cases yet.
name: Northern Mariana Islands

notes: Negative = total tests (state lab only) - total positives (state and commercial labs). This is a lower bound for actual negatives. Positives seem to occasionally update before totals do; when this happens, rather than revising negatives down, we keep the last calculated negative. Update time is the "as of" time listed in the state chart. Hospitalizations are calculated based on the % in the pie chart.
name: Mississippi

notes: Negatives are calculated from total positives (public and commercial labs) and total tests (which only includes public labs and partial data from hospital and commercial labs). Hospitalization from [media reports](https://www.starnewsonline.com/news/20200325/wilmington-coronavirus-new-hanover-county-covid-19-cases-rise-to-14).
name: North Carolina

notes: Numbers reflect only those tested at the public health lab. North Dakota stopped reporting pending numbers.
name: North Dakota

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Latest positive count from [separate press release](http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/Additional-COVID-19-cases-reported-in-Lancaster,-Buffalo-and-Douglas-Counties.aspx).
name: Nebraska

notes: Since state doesn't publish negatives we infer it with this formula: Negatives = Total Number of Persons Tested at NH PHL - Number of Persons with COVID-19 - Number of Persons with Test Pending in PHL
name: New Hampshire

notes: Positive count includes deaths. Negatives now include all laboratories. There's a [dashboard available](covid19.nj.gov) but the testing data there is not as comprehensive as [this table](www.nj.gov/health).
name: New Jersey

notes: Positives number from press release more recent than negatives number reported on website.
name: New Mexico

notes: We calculate pending from Totals – Positives – Negatives. Multiple update times for various sources of data on the dashboard; we use the latest timestamp for our "Last Update" time. One of the rare states to distinguish people tested from individual tests since people may be tested more than once. We use the people number. Death from [news report](https://www.fox5vegas.com/coronavirus/snhd-reports-cases-in-southern-nevada-second-covid--death/article_e2edf65a-6af0-11ea-a5d2-8b4b44192fb1.html).
name: Nevada

notes: Numbers come from [press conference](https://www.governor.ny.gov).
name: New York

notes: State released a total tested number in [a slide deck](https://www.dropbox.com/s/d8od1r2zr9wrsnv/Ohio%203-25%20Presser.pdf?dl=0). "Last Updated" time on website is not updated consistently, however our screen captures of the page indicate the page actually is being updated, so our update time doesn't always match the one displayed on the page.
name: Ohio

notes: Pending = "PUIs pending results." We exclude "Positive (Out-of-State)" results as we assume these individuals are isolated outside the state. Last Update time based on the "As of" time below the charts.
name: Oklahoma

notes: County level data doesn't add up to the totals provided. We don't add deaths back into positives until we have more clarity on whether they are already included in the positive count.
name: Pennsylvania

notes: Hospitalized number from [a media report](https://www.providencejournal.com/news/20200325/8-new-coronavirus-cases-in-ri-new-guidelines-coming-for-grocery-stores-and-retailers).
name: Rhode Island

notes: Negatives only from state public health labs.
name: South Carolina

notes: Tennessee now provides positive and negative test results from all laboratories.
name: Tennessee

notes: We are assuming Texas is reporting only completed testing, pending further guidance, which we are seeking from the state.
name: Texas

notes: Positives include non-Utah residents. Negative = Total - Positive. Negative test results may lag for up to 72 hours, according to the state.
name: Utah

notes: Virgin Islands: Positives and deaths provided.
name: US Virgin Islands

notes: Total tests are below the tables with positive cases. Positive includes deaths. Per the state's guidance, the current negatives number is from 3/23, with updates pending.
name: Washington

notes: No pending counts. Positive = “Positive” + “Positive Recovered”
name: Wisconsin

notes: Pending = "Under Investigation". Hospitalization only reported [by media](https://wchstv.com/news/local/judicial-employee-hospitalized-with-covid-19).
name: West Virginia

notes: Wyoming's guidance is that commercial labs are only irregularly reporting negatives. Positive counts were reduced by from 3/18 > 3/19. Negatives = Total - Positive.
name: Wyoming
